Posts.Content: Having your hair cut is a big thing but just go a bit shorter and you wont regret it .. its so much easier to cope with and bear in mind you cant wash it very often.  I have had one EC, 2nd on Tuesday, using cold cap, and all was good until yesterday .. it seems to be coming out in handfuls.  However, I've been told this is normal and I will persevere until it looks ridiculous. As for the gym, I'm back there and all is fine... don't feel much like it the chemo week, but the two weeks following I was fine .. I woudn't say I was doing vigourous exercise, have kept off the weights, but am slowly building back up. Going back to the gym has given me back my control.

Posts.Content: I have now had 3 x EC and 3 more to go .. unfortunately the vein in my chemo arm is a bit tender after number 3 and I told the chemo nurses this.  They said they would give me the chemo in the other arm .. but as Ive had lymph node clearance in the other arm, I told them they couldn't.  They said they would check with my ONC but thought for one EC it would be ok.  Now everything and everyone has told me, under no circumstances, should the nodeless arm be used ... never!  Can anyone advise me?  I only have 3 to go and I guess a PICC line is the answer .. just seems alot of fuss for the remaining 3 ECs.  However, I don't want to risk lymphodema.  Help???
Posts.Title: chemo in affected arm

Posts.Content: The cannula was always in my hand but the drugs have affected the veins in my arm .. I voiced my fears and had a portacath implanted yesterday for the last 3 ECs.. seemed the best option as it only requires flushing every 3 weeks or so .. less chance of infection than a PICC line .. and no external bits so no chance of catching it or anything.  Can shower, swim, bathe and everything with a portacath .. wish I'd had it right from the begining now.  I did ask but was told finding veins would be no problem.... nobody mentioned messing your veins up!!!
Posts.Title: chemo in affected arm

Posts.Content: Hello M Bear .. what a nightmare you've had!  I agree though, nobody told me either about the damage to my veins .. I did initially ask for a PICC or Portacath before I started chemo and was told there was no need for that .. we'll find a vein.  As you know, its not about finding veins, its about damaging them, and we have to live with those veins for the rest of our lives!  It makes me so angry....
